eventname: Development for Deans and Academic Leaders Recording Series
eventinfo: Driven by CASE’s continuing efforts to develop the most relevant content to prepare academic leaders for the changing landscape of advancement, this conference has become the standard of excellence in training for deans, presidents, provosts and other academic leaders with fundraising responsibility. This seminar consists of eight curated pre-recorded sessions allowing you to learn at your own pace anywhere, any time! Recordings will be available to registrants immediately after registration. Access information will be sent in the automated receipt email. The program will review core concepts needed by academic leaders looking for a comprehensive introduction to development. Topics include top development tips for academic leaders; creating a true partnership between the academic leader and their development officer; the role of the dean in successful development; preparing for a successful donor visit; how to create purposeful advisory boards; building a donor pipeline and managing your portfolio; and the dean’s role in transformational gifts. Registration is available through June 15. Registrants will have access to the recordings through June 30, 2022.

eventname: The Future of Major Giving in Schools
eventinfo: Join us for a conversation about major gift work in Independent Schools. In this session, Kathryn Van Sickle will lead a conversation about working with volunteers, building pipelines, and strategies to best engage your Head of School with donors. Kathryn brings a higher ed background to her work in the Independent School space and is looking forward to talking about raising your sights with major gifts.

eventinfo: Homecomings and reunions provide the highest visibility opportunities to engage alumni from all generations. Institutions are creating new traditions and maximizing existing ones to make the most of this annual stalwart of alumni relations. Join us to explore, create and rebuild new program models to fit your institution's needs. This conference is designed for newcomers to the advancement profession and professionals with mid- and senior-level responsibility.

eventinfo: Social media has never been more important than it is today. Over the last year, classes and experiences moved online, but as social media managers, we were already there. Our expertise was needed. Our minds were challenged. And we accomplished so much. Together, across our institutions, we showed the value of social media. Now, it's time to take advantage of this momentum. As we head past the pandemic, it's important that we learn from our experiences, take advantage of our "wins" and ensure social media has a seat at the table in our post-pandemic world. How are you planning for the future? How are you advocating for your work? Join us at Social Media and Community in San Francisco, CA, and let's talk about how we can make strides together to grow our field and improve the day-to-day work and how it can best fit institutional goals as we head into a new era.

eventinfo: Loyal donors are essential to a healthy fundraising pipeline and excellent stewardship plays a crucial role in building that loyalty, keeping donors engaged and giving again. Join us back in London this June for our CASE Donor Relations and Stewardship Conference. Gain expertise from professionals in your sector, build connections and network with your peers. There will be sessions and studies on key topics - spanning stewardship and events - as well as opportunities for discussion in roundtables. The Conference will aim to cover the full range of Donor Relations activity (or as much as we can possibly fit into one day!) – from long-term strategy to quick wins.

eventinfo: Records management and gift processing are sometimes located in the same office, or handled in separate departments, but their processes are inextricably linked and better together. Explore the trends in digitization that help us communicate, connect, and collaborate in new and exciting ways, and how you can use accessible tools for onboarding, training, and teambuilding. We’ll also review core concepts needed such as data governance and compliance obligations; identify opportunities for process efficiencies and improving basic gift processing; learn how to set, prioritize, and achieve data hygiene goals; and discuss standard and nonstandard gift processes.
